intro: Conostylis crassinerva, commonly known as the broad-veined conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spikelet with several small, spike-like flowers. Conostylis crassinerva is typically found in sandy soils and is often seen in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands.
